comment.text: Produces nitric oxide (NO) which is a messenger molecule with diverse functions throughout the body (PubMed:7531687, PubMed:7544004). In macrophages, NO mediates tumoricidal and bactericidal actions. Also has nitrosylase activity and mediates cysteine S-nitrosylation of cytoplasmic target proteins such PTGS2/COX2 (By similarity). As component of the iNOS-S100A8/9 transnitrosylase complex involved in the selective inflammatory stimulus-dependent S-nitrosylation of GAPDH on 'Cys-247' implicated in regulation of the GAIT complex activity and probably multiple targets including ANXA5, EZR, MSN and VIM (PubMed:25417112). Involved in inflammation, enhances the synthesis of proinflammatory mediators such as IL6 and IL8 (PubMed:19688109).

reaction.text: H(+) + 2 L-arginine + 3 NADPH + 4 O2 = 4 H2O + 2 L-citrulline + 3 NADP(+) + 2 nitric oxide

comment.text: Tetrahydrobiopterin (BH4). May stabilize the dimeric form of the enzyme.

Regulated by calcium/calmodulin. Aspirin inhibits expression and function of this enzyme and effects may be exerted at the level of translational/post-translational modification and directly on the catalytic activity (By similarity).

Homodimer (PubMed:10409685, PubMed:10074942). Interacts with SLC9A3R1 (PubMed:12080081). Interacts with GAPDH; induced by oxidatively-modified low-densitity lipoprotein (LDL(ox)) (PubMed:25417112). Interacts with S100A8 and S100A9 to form the iNOS-S100A8/9 transnitrosylase complex (PubMed:25417112). Interacts with SPSB1, SPSB2 and SPSB4 (PubMed:21199876). Interacts with ELOC and CUL5 in the presence of SPSB1 or SPSB2 or SPSB4 (PubMed:21199876).
Localizes as discrete foci scattered throughout the cytosol and in the presence of SPSB1 and SPSB4, exhibits a more diffuse cytosolic localization.
Expressed in the liver, retina, bone cells and airway epithelial cells of the lung. Not expressed in the platelets.

By endotoxins and cytokines. Induced by IFNG/IFN-gamma acting synergistically with bacterial lipopolysaccharides (LPS), TNF or IL1B/interleukin-1 beta (PubMed:7528267). Down-regulated by zinc due to inhibition of NF-kappa-B transactivation activity (PubMed:25180171). By oxidatively-modified low-densitity lipoprotein (LDL(ox)) (PubMed:25417112).
Polyubiquitinated; mediated by SPSB1, SPSB2 and SPSB4, leading to proteasomal degradation.
Genetic variations in NOS2 are involved in resistance to malaria [MIM:611162].

property.value: ROS and RNS production in phagocytes
Expressed in cartilage tissue and 113 other tissues
F:oxidoreductase activity, acting on paired donors, with incorporation or reduction of molecular oxygen, NAD(P)H as one donor, and incorporation of one atom of oxygen
P:negative regulation of protein catabolic process
P:positive regulation of guanylate cyclase activity
P:positive regulation of killing of cells of other organism
P:positive regulation of leukocyte mediated cytotoxicity
P:regulation of cytokine production involved in inflammatory response

feature.description: DINNN-motif; mediates interaction with SPSB1, SPSB2 and SPSB4
Polymorphism; found in patients with very early onset inflammatory bowel disease; increases NOS2 activity; dbSNP:rs2297518.
In a breast cancer sample; somatic mutation; dbSNP:rs769900089.
Loss of interaction with SPSB1 and SPSB4.
